intro: Navarretia paradoxiclara, commonly known as the paradoxical navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of California and Baja California. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, clustered flowers and delicate foliage. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils along the coastline, thriving in coastal climates with moderate temperatures and coastal fog. Its blooming period occurs in late winter to early spring, producing white to pale purple flowers that attract pollinators. Navarretia paradoxiclara is known for its unique growth habit and ecological significance in coastal ecosystems.
